baseline_groups.claim_summary: Patient vouchers for antimalarial drugs increase the probability that patients purchase any malaria treatment (simple or severe).
baseline_groups.notes: Single baseline from RCT in Mali. Coef 0.153 (SE=0.038, p<0.001). Includes 35 date dummies as controls, clustered at clinic-day level.

global_notes: 92 total specs. One primary claim (patient voucher increases treatment purchase). Alternative outcomes, heterogeneity interactions, placebos are non-core. Two het specs report interaction coefficient (treatment_var=patient_voucher_high). doctor_voucher_only and any_voucher change the treatment variable.
